title: Juvenile found dead of gunshot wound identified
content:
LAS VEGAS (FOX5) -
Metro Police are investigating a juvenile found dead with a gunshot wound inside a southwest valley home Saturday before 5:30 p.m.
This incident happened at a home on the 9100 block of Wine Cellar Avenue near El Capitan and Pebble.
According to a LVMPD release, police were dispatched to the home just before 5:30 p.m. Saturday after reports that a child had been shot. When officers arrived on scene they found a child with an apparent gunshot wound. Medical personnel pronounced him dead on scene.
An investigation by Metro's Abuse and Neglect unit showed the child lived in the home where he was found and the gunshot wound was self-inflicted. There were no adults present when the incident occurred but police say the gun that was used is registered to someone who lives in that house.
The Clark County Coroner's Office identified the child as eight year-old Clayton Singleton. An official cause of death has not yet been released.
An investigation is ongoing but police urge anyone with information to contact their Abuse and Neglect Detail at (702) 828-3364 or remain anonymous by calling Crime Stoppers at (702) 385-5555.
Stay with FOX5 and FOX5Vegas.com for updates on this developing story.
